glossentry.glossdef: Re-Authorization Answer is a message that is sent in response to the Re-Auth Request (RAR) command.
Remote Authentication Dial-In User Service is a widely deployed system to provide authentication, authorization, and accounting for network access.
Re-Auth Request command is sent to provision the Policy and Charging Control rules.
Radio Access Technology is a connection method for radio based communication.
Redis is an open source, in-memory and key/value NoSQL databaseand is used to store data refinery data for CDRs and Assume Positive feature.

Real-time charging is a method of call accounting procedure that enables Communication Service Providers (CSPs) to apply rules that are specific to the customer for rating, discount, promotions, and settlements to improve and personalize the telecom experience.
Representational State Transfer (REST) is a software architectural style that defines a set of constraints to be used for creating Web services over HTTP.
A Result Context is a collection of result attributes produced by running the Rule Set through the rule engine.
The Ro and Gy diameter interface is used as a native interface for charging and rating a session or event based charging service.
The rollback manager restores the original values to the DB records to return the DB to its pre-transaction state.
A Rule is a row in the Rule Group that is comprised of a set of Rule Conditions and a set of Rule Actions.
The dictionary files are XML files containing the definition of all the source contexts, usable attributes, result contexts, and action attributes in the active Rule System Version (RSV) instance.

NCC CNF includes a powerful, flexible, and high performance Agile Rule Technology (ART) rule engine. It enables customization of NCC logic and flows without requiring any code changes. Rules can be used for customization of existing services and flows and can even be used for creating additional new use cases.
A Rule Group is a grouping of related Rules that can be run as a logical group. A Rule Group is usually associated with one or more Triggers.
All rule groups and variables are part of a container called a Rule System Version (RSV).
Real-time Transport Protocol defines a standardized packet format to deliver the audio and video over IP networks.
